Header: Chief Prelates say a stable Government is necessary to serve the nation
Content: Malwatte and Asgiriya Chief Prelates point out that a stable government is necessary to serve the people. The Theras have emphasized that since the people had placed their trust in the President, this confidence should be consolidated in the incumbent President by establishing a stable government. The Malwatte and Asgiriya Chief Prelates made these references when State Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage called on them. The Minister who paid obeisance to the sacred tooth relics first called on the Malwatte Chief Prelate the Most Ven. Thibbotuwawe Sri Sumangala Thera Thereafter Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage visited the Asgiriya Vihare and paid a courtesy call on the Asgiriya Mahanayake the Most Ven. Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thera. The Registrar of the Asgiriya Vihare the Ven. Medagama Dhammananda Thera joined in the occasion.
